articles.title: Prediction market exchange Kalshi sues Utah over proposed prop betting ban
articles.summary: Kalshi has filed a lawsuit against Utah to block the state's proposed ban on proposition betting. The case could set crucial precedent for how states regulate prediction markets, potentially affecting whether other jurisdictions can restrict event-based trading that doesn't involve traditional sports gambling.

articles.title: Protracted legal fight expected in Nevada v. Kalshi
articles.summary: Nevada is gearing up for a lengthy court battle against Kalshi, the prediction market platform that's been expanding into sports betting territory. This fight will likely determine whether traditional gambling regulators can block prediction markets from offering contracts that blur the line between financial instruments and sports wagers.

articles.title: Prediction market exchange Kalshi sues Utah over proposed prop betting ban
articles.summary: Kalshi filed a lawsuit against Utah to block the state's proposed ban on proposition betting, arguing the restriction would illegally limit its prediction market operations. The case could set a crucial precedent for how states regulate prediction markets versus traditional sports betting, potentially affecting where platforms can operate and what events they can list.

articles.title: Kalshi sues to block Utah from cracking down on prediction markets
articles.summary: Kalshi filed a lawsuit to prevent Utah from implementing new restrictions or regulations targeting prediction markets. The case could set important legal precedent for how states can regulate prediction markets, potentially affecting market access and operations nationwide.

articles.title: What will Trump say at State of the Union? Here's Americans best bets
articles.summary: Americans are placing bets on what Trump will say during his upcoming State of the Union address, wagering on everything from specific policy mentions to rhetorical flourishes. These speech prediction markets offer bettors a chance to profit from political theater while revealing which talking points insiders expect Trump to prioritize in his biggest annual address.

articles.title: Buzz of the Week: How should Utah handle online sports betting through ‘prediction markets’?
articles.summary: Utah legislators are debating whether to allow online sports betting by classifying it as "prediction markets" rather than traditional gambling. This semantic sleight of hand could open the floodgates for sports betting in one of America's most restrictive gambling states while potentially legitimizing prediction markets as a workaround for anti-gambling laws nationwide.

articles.title: Will the State of the Union be __ minutes? Predictions & ...
articles.summary: Prediction markets are betting on the exact length of Biden's upcoming State of the Union address, with bettors wagering on specific minute ranges. The speech length has become a surprisingly liquid market because presidential speaking patterns are predictable enough to generate edge, but random enough to create genuine uncertainty around the margins.

articles.title: ‘Hockey’ and ‘World Cup’ references top Kalshi odds on Trump’s State of the Union address
articles.summary: Kalshi bettors are wagering that Trump will mention "hockey" and "World Cup" during his upcoming State of the Union address, with these references currently leading the odds board for specific words or topics he'll bring up. The betting action shows how prediction markets have evolved beyond traditional political outcomes to granular speech content, creating new opportunities for traders who can parse presidential rhetoric patterns and cultural touchstones.

articles.title: From niche to $3 billion run rate: prediction markets eye $10 billion future, Citizens says
articles.summary: Citizens projects prediction markets will hit a $10 billion valuation after reaching a $3 billion annual run rate, marking the sector's rapid evolution from experimental curiosity to mainstream financial instrument. The forecast signals institutional acceptance is accelerating, which means more liquidity, tighter spreads, and legitimate competition for traditional polling and forecasting methods.

articles.title: States are fighting back against online prediction markets
articles.summary: State regulators are cracking down on online prediction markets, likely targeting platforms that operate without proper licensing or exceed legal boundaries. This regulatory pushback could force major platforms to restrict access in certain states or face costly compliance battles that reshape how Americans bet on politics and current events.

articles.title: Senate Democrats press CFTC chair on prediction markets
articles.summary: Senate Democrats are grilling CFTC Chair Rostin Behnam about the agency's recent approval of political prediction markets like Kalshi. This signals growing political pressure that could slow or reverse the regulatory momentum that's been opening up betting on elections and policy outcomes.

articles.title: The ‘Mentions’ Market Tries to Predict the Unpredictable: Trump’s Next Words
articles.summary: Traders are betting on what specific words or phrases Trump will say next, turning his famously unpredictable speech patterns into a wagering opportunity. The market highlights how prediction platforms are expanding beyond traditional political outcomes to monetize literally anything that generates public attention and has measurable results.
